longInfo:
Passport required.
- Nationals of Spain are allowed to enter with an expired
  passport. The passport is accepted when expired for a
  maximum of 5 years.
- National ID cards issued to nationals of Spain must be valid
  on arrival. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of a National ID Card issued to nationals of Spain.

Visa required, except for Those of Turkish origin holding
foreign passport and a National ID Card issued by Turkey
(Nufus Card).
- OR
Visa Issuance:
Visa required, except for Holders of normal passports or
National ID Cards issued to nationals of Spain can obtain a
visa on arrival at e-Visa kiosks, for a max. stay of 3 months.
(SEE NOTE 55008) 
    NOTE 55008: Fee: USD 30.-, EUR 25.- or GBP 20.- for
   nationals of Spain. 
Minors:
- Up to/incl. 18 years of age may be included in parent's
  passport. 
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of Spain will be expected to
  hold their own passport or National ID Card (where
  applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus,
  Romania or a Schengen Member State . 
Additional Information:
- If it appears from the documents of a non-Turkish passenger
  that their original nationality was Turkish,
   
- Those eligible for an e-Visa who have applied for an e-Visa
  online prior to departure must present a printed e-visa
  confirmation.
- Visitors who require a visa, must also hold proof of hotel
  reservation and documents for their next destination .
- Visitors exceeding the period for which they are allowed to
  stay 
Warning:
- Passports and all other travel documents in booklet form of
  all non-Turkish nationals must contain at least 1 unused
  visa page 
- Visitors who require a visa and do not hold return/onward
  ticket could be refused entry
vaccination:
Vaccinations not required.

Recommended:
- Malaria prophylaxis. malaria risk, exclusively due to P.
  vivax, is very low - exists from May to October in the
  provinces of Diyarbakir, Mardin and Sanliurfa. There is no
  malaria risk in the main tourist areas in the west and
  south-west of the country. Recommended prevention in risk
  areas: A.
